column2: 'I found the Palace of Green Porcelain, when we approached it about noon, deserted and falling into ruin.
column3: 'I found the Palace of Green Porcelain, when we approached it about noon, deserted and falling into ruin.

column2: It lay very high upon a turfy down, and looking north-eastward before I entered it, I was surprised to see a large estuary, or even creek, where I judged Wandsworth and Battersea must once have been.
column3: It lay very high upon a turfy down, and looking north eastward before I entered it, I was surprised to see a large estuary, or even creek, where I judged Wandsworth and Battersea must once have been.

column2: 'The material of the Palace proved on examination to be indeed porcelain, and along the face of it I saw an inscription in some unknown character.
column3: 'The material of the Palace proved on examination to be indeed porcelain, and along the face of it I saw an inscription in some unknown character.

column2: I thought, rather foolishly, that Weena might help me to interpret this, but I only learned that the bare idea of writing had never entered her head.
column3: I thought, rather foolishly, that Weena might help me to interpret this, but I only learned that the bare idea of writing had never entered her head.

column2: She always seemed to me, I fancy, more human than she was, perhaps because her affection was so human.
column3: She always seemed to me, I fancy, more human than she was, perhaps because her affection was so human.

column2: 'Within the big valves of the door--which were open and broken--we found, instead of the customary hall, a long gallery lit by many side windows.
column3: 'Within the big valves of the door-which were open and broken-we found, instead of the customary hall, a long gallery lit by many side windows.

column2: At the first glance I was reminded of a museum. The tiled floor was thick with dust, and a remarkable array of miscellaneous objects was shrouded in the same grey covering.
column3: At the first glance I was reminded of a museum. The tiled floor was thick with dust, and a remarkable array of miscellaneous objects was shrouded in the same grey covering.

column2: I recognized by the oblique feet that it was some extinct creature after the fashion of the Megatherium.
column3: I recognized by the oblique feet that it was some extinct creature after the fashion of the Megatherium.

column2: Further in the gallery was the huge skeleton barrel of a Brontosaurus.
column3: Further in the gallery was the huge skeleton barrel of a Brontosaurus.

column2: My museum hypothesis was confirmed.
column3: My museum hypothesis was confirmed.

column2: Going towards the side I found what appeared to be sloping shelves, and clearing away the thick dust, I found the old familiar glass cases of our own time.
column3: Going towards the side I found what appeared to be sloping shelves, and clearing away the thick dust, I found the old familiar glass cases of our own time.

column2: But they must have been air-tight to judge from the fair preservation of some of their contents.
column3: But they must have been air tight to judge from the fair preservation of some of their contents.

column2: 'Clearly we stood among the ruins of some latter-day South Kensington!
column3: 'Clearly we stood among the ruins of some latter day South Kensington!

column2: And the cases had in some instances been bodily removed--by the Morlocks as I judged.
column3: And the cases had in some instances been bodily removed-by the Morlocks as I judged.

column2: The place was very silent.
column3: The place was very silent.

column2: The thick dust deadened our footsteps.
column3: The thick dust deadened our footsteps.

column2: Weena, who had been rolling a sea urchin down the sloping glass of a case, presently came, as I stared about me, and very quietly took my hand and stood beside me.
column3: Weena, who had been rolling a sea urchin down the sloping glass of a case, presently came, as I stared about me, and very quietly took my hand and stood beside me.

column2: 'And at first I was so much surprised by this ancient monument of an intellectual age, that I gave no thought to the possibilities it presented.
column3: 'And at first I was so much surprised by this ancient monument of an intellectual age, that I gave no thought to the possibilities it presented.

column2: Even my preoccupation about the Time Machine receded a little from my mind.
column3: Even my preoccupation about the Time Machine receded a little from my mind.

column2: 'To judge from the size of the place, this Palace of Green Porcelain had a great deal more in it than a Gallery of Palaeontology; possibly historical galleries; it might be, even a library!
column3: 'To judge from the size of the place, this Palace of Green Porcelain had a great deal more in it than a Gallery of Palaeontology; possibly historical galleries; it might be, even a library!

column2: To me, at least in my present circumstances, these would be vastly more interesting than this spectacle of oldtime geology in decay. Exploring, I found another short gallery running transversely to the first.
column3: To me, at least in my present circumstances, these would be vastly more interesting than this spectacle of oldtime geology in decay. Exploring, I found another short gallery running transversely to the first.

column2: This appeared to be devoted to minerals, and the sight of a block of sulphur set my mind running on gunpowder.
column3: This appeared to be devoted to minerals, and the sight of a block of sulphur set my mind running on gunpowder.

column2: But I could find no saltpeter; indeed, no nitrates of any kind.
column3: But I could find no saltpeter; indeed, no nitrates of any kind.

column2: Doubtless they had deliquesced ages ago.
column3: Doubtless they had deliquesced ages ago.

column2: Yet the sulphur hung in my mind, and set up a train of thinking.
column3: Yet the sulphur hung in my mind, and set up a train of thinking.

column2: As for the rest of the contents of that gallery, though on the whole they were the best preserved of all I saw, I had little interest.
column3: As for the rest of the contents of that gallery, though on the whole they were the best preserved of all I saw, I had little interest.

column2: I am no specialist in mineralogy, and I went on down a very ruinous aisle running parallel to the first hall I had entered.
column3: I am no specialist in mineralogy, and I went on down a very ruinous aisle running parallel to the first hall I had entered.

column2: Apparently this section had been devoted to natural history, but everything had long since passed out of recognition.
column3: Apparently this section had been devoted to natural history, but everything had long since passed out of recognition.

column2: I was sorry for that, because I should have been glad to trace the patent readjustments by which the conquest of animated nature had been attained.
column3: I was sorry for that, because I should have been glad to trace the patent readjustments by which the conquest of animated nature had been attained.

column2: Then we came to a gallery of simply colossal proportions, but singularly ill-lit, the floor of it running downward at a slight angle from the end at which I entered.
column3: Then we came to a gallery of simply colossal proportions, but singularly ill lit, the floor of it running downward at a slight angle from the end at which I entered.

column2: At intervals white globes hung from the ceiling--many of them cracked and smashed--which suggested that originally the place had been artificially lit.
column3: At intervals white globes hung from the ceiling-many of them cracked and smashed-which suggested that originally the place had been artificially lit.

column2: Here I was more in my element, for rising on either side of me were the huge bulks of big machines, all greatly corroded and many broken down, but some still fairly complete.
column3: Here I was more in my element, for rising on either side of me were the huge bulks of big machines, all greatly corroded and many broken down, but some still fairly complete.

column2: You know I have a certain weakness for mechanism, and I was inclined to linger among these; the more so as for the most part they had the interest of puzzles, and I could make only the vaguest guesses at what they were for.
column3: You know I have a certain weakness for mechanism, and I was inclined to linger among these; the more so as for the most part they had the interest of puzzles, and I could make only the vaguest guesses at what they were for.

column2: 'Suddenly Weena came very close to my side.
column3: 'Suddenly Weena came very close to my side.

column2: So suddenly that she startled me.
column3: So suddenly that she startled me.

column2: Had it not been for her I do not think I should have noticed that the floor of the gallery sloped at all.
column3: Had it not been for her I do not think I should have noticed that the floor of the gallery sloped at all.

column2: As you went down the length, the ground came up against these windows, until at last there was a pit like the "area" of a London house before each, and only a narrow line of daylight at the top.
column3: As you went down the length, the ground came up against these windows, until at last there was a pit like the "area" of a London house before each, and only a narrow line of daylight at the top.

column2: Then I saw that the gallery ran down at last into a thick darkness.
column3: Then I saw that the gallery ran down at last into a thick darkness.

column2: Further away towards the dimness, it appeared to be broken by a number of small narrow footprints.
column3: Further away towards the dimness, it appeared to be broken by a number of small narrow footprints.

column2: My sense of the immediate presence of the Morlocks revived at that. I felt that I was wasting my time in the academic examination of machinery.
column3: My sense of the immediate presence of the Morlocks revived at that. I felt that I was wasting my time in the academic examination of machinery.

column2: And then down in the remote blackness of the gallery I heard a peculiar pattering, and the same odd noises I had heard down the well.
column3: And then down in the remote blackness of the gallery I heard a peculiar pattering, and the same odd noises I had heard down the well.

column2: 'I took Weena's hand.
column3: 'I took Weena's hand.

column2: Then, struck with a sudden idea, I left her and turned to a machine from which projected a lever not unlike those in a signal-box.
column3: Then, struck with a sudden idea, I left her and turned to a machine from which projected a lever not unlike those in a signal box.

column2: Clambering upon the stand, and grasping this lever in my hands, I put all my weight upon it sideways.
column3: Clambering upon the stand, and grasping this lever in my hands, I put all my weight upon it sideways.

column2: Suddenly Weena, deserted in the central aisle, began to whimper.
column3: Suddenly Weena, deserted in the central aisle, began to whimper.

column2: And I longed very much to kill a Morlock or so.
column3: And I longed very much to kill a Morlock or so.

column2: Very inhuman, you may think, to want to go killing one's own descendants!
column3: Very inhuman, you may think, to want to go killing one's own descendants!

column2: But it was impossible, somehow, to feel any humanity in the things.
column3: But it was impossible, somehow, to feel any humanity in the things.

column2: Only my disinclination to leave Weena, and a persuasion that if I began to slake my thirst for murder my Time Machine might suffer, restrained me from going straight down the gallery and killing the brutes I heard.
column3: Only my disinclination to leave Weena, and a persuasion that if I began to slake my thirst for murder my Time Machine might suffer, restrained me from going straight down the gallery and killing the brutes I heard.

column2: 'Well, mace in one hand and Weena in the other, I went out of that gallery and into another and still larger one, which at the first glance reminded me of a military chapel hung with tattered flags. The brown and charred rags that hung from the sides of it, I presently recognized as the decaying vestiges of books.
column3: 'Well, mace in one hand and Weena in the other, I went out of that gallery and into another and still larger one, which at the first glance reminded me of a military chapel hung with tattered flags. The brown and charred rags that hung from the sides of it, I presently recognized as the decaying vestiges of books.

column2: They had long since dropped to pieces, and every semblance of print had left them.
column3: They had long since dropped to pieces, and every semblance of print had left them.

column2: Had I been a literary man I might, perhaps, have moralized upon the futility of all ambition. But as it was, the thing that struck me with keenest force was the enormous waste of labour to which this sombre wilderness of rotting paper testified.
column3: Had I been a literary man I might, perhaps, have moralized upon the futility of all ambition. But as it was, the thing that struck me with keenest force was the enormous waste of labour to which this sombre wilderness of rotting paper testified.

column2: 'Then, going up a broad staircase, we came to what may once have been a gallery of technical chemistry.
column3: 'Then, going up a broad staircase, we came to what may once have been a gallery of technical chemistry.

column2: And here I had not a little hope of useful discoveries.
column3: And here I had not a little hope of useful discoveries.

column2: Except at one end where the roof had collapsed, this gallery was well preserved.
column3: Except at one end where the roof had collapsed, this gallery was well preserved.

column2: I went eagerly to every unbroken case.
column3: I went eagerly to every unbroken case.

column2: And at last, in one of the really air-tight cases, I found a box of matches.
column3: And at last, in one of the really air tight cases, I found a box of matches.

column2: Very eagerly I tried them.
column3: Very eagerly I tried them.

column2: They were perfectly good.
column3: They were perfectly good.

column2: I turned to Weena.
column3: I turned to Weena.

column2: Dance, I cried to her in her own tongue.
column3: Dance, I cried to her in her own tongue.

column2: For now I had a weapon indeed against the horrible creatures we feared.
column3: For now I had a weapon indeed against the horrible creatures we feared.

column2: For I am naturally inventive, as you know.
column3: For I am naturally inventive, as you know.

column2: 'Now, I still think that for this box of matches to have escaped the wear of time for immemorial years was a most strange, as for me it was a most fortunate thing.
column3: 'Now, I still think that for this box of matches to have escaped the wear of time for immemorial years was a most strange, as for me it was a most fortunate thing.

column2: Yet, oddly enough, I found a far unlikelier substance, and that was camphor.
column3: Yet, oddly enough, I found a far unlikelier substance, and that was camphor.

column2: In the universal decay this volatile substance had chanced to survive, perhaps through many thousands of centuries.
column3: In the universal decay this volatile substance had chanced to survive, perhaps through many thousands of centuries.

column2: I was about to throw it away, but I remembered that it was inflammable and burned with a good bright flame--was, in fact, an excellent candle--and I put it in my pocket.
column3: I was about to throw it away, but I remembered that it was inflammable and burned with a good bright flame-was, in fact, an excellent candle-and I put it in my pocket.

column2: I found no explosives, however, nor any means of breaking down the bronze doors.
column3: I found no explosives, however, nor any means of breaking down the bronze doors.

column2: As yet my iron crowbar was the most helpful thing I had chanced upon.
column3: As yet my iron crowbar was the most helpful thing I had chanced upon.

column2: Nevertheless I left that gallery greatly elated.
column3: Nevertheless I left that gallery greatly elated.

column2: It would require a great effort of memory to recall my explorations in at all the proper order.
column3: It would require a great effort of memory to recall my explorations in at all the proper order.

column2: I remember a long gallery of rusting stands of arms, and how I hesitated between my crowbar and a hatchet or a sword.
column3: I remember a long gallery of rusting stands of arms, and how I hesitated between my crowbar and a hatchet or a sword.

column2: I could not carry both, however, and my bar of iron promised best against the bronze gates.
column3: I could not carry both, however, and my bar of iron promised best against the bronze gates.

column2: The most were masses of rust, but many were of some new metal, and still fairly sound.
column3: The most were masses of rust, but many were of some new metal, and still fairly sound.

column2: But any cartridges or powder there may once have been had rotted into dust.
column3: But any cartridges or powder there may once have been had rotted into dust.

column2: One corner I saw was charred and shattered; perhaps, I thought, by an explosion among the specimens.
column3: One corner I saw was charred and shattered; perhaps, I thought, by an explosion among the specimens.

column2: 'As the evening drew on, my interest waned.
column3: 'As the evening drew on, my interest waned.

column2: I went through gallery after gallery, dusty, silent, often ruinous, the exhibits sometimes mere heaps of rust and lignite, sometimes fresher.
column3: I went through gallery after gallery, dusty, silent, often ruinous, the exhibits sometimes mere heaps of rust and lignite, sometimes fresher.

column2: In one place I suddenly found myself near the model of a tin-mine, and then by the merest accident I discovered, in an air-tight case, two dynamite cartridges!
column3: In one place I suddenly found myself near the model of a tin mine, and then by the merest accident I discovered, in an air tight case, two dynamite cartridges!

column2: I shouted "Eureka!" and smashed the case with joy.
column3: I shouted "Eureka!" and smashed the case with joy.

column2: Then came a doubt.
column3: Then came a doubt.

column2: I hesitated.
column3: I hesitated.

column2: Then, selecting a little side gallery, I made my essay.
column3: Then, selecting a little side gallery, I made my essay.

column2: I never felt such a disappointment as I did in waiting five, ten, fifteen minutes for an explosion that never came. Of course the things were dummies, as I might have guessed from their presence.
column3: I never felt such a disappointment as I did in waiting five, ten, fifteen minutes for an explosion that never came. Of course the things were dummies, as I might have guessed from their presence.

column2: I really believe that had they not been so, I should have rushed off incontinently and blown Sphinx, bronze doors, and (as it proved) my chances of finding the Time Machine, all together into non-existence.
column3: I really believe that had they not been so, I should have rushed off incontinently and blown Sphinx, bronze doors, and (as it proved) my chances of finding the Time Machine, all together into non existence.

column2: 'It was after that, I think, that we came to a little open court within the palace.
column3: 'It was after that, I think, that we came to a little open court within the palace.

column2: It was turfed, and had three fruit-trees.
column3: It was turfed, and had three fruit trees.

column2: Towards sunset I began to consider our position.
column3: Towards sunset I began to consider our position.

column2: But that troubled me very little now.
column3: But that troubled me very little now.

column2: I had in my possession a thing that was, perhaps, the best of all defences against the Morlocks--I had matches!
column3: I had in my possession a thing that was, perhaps, the best of all defences against the Morlocks-I had matches!

column2: I had the camphor in my pocket, too, if a blaze were needed.
column3: I had the camphor in my pocket, too, if a blaze were needed.

column2: It seemed to me that the best thing we could do would be to pass the night in the open, protected by a fire.
column3: It seemed to me that the best thing we could do would be to pass the night in the open, protected by a fire.

column2: In the morning there was the getting of the Time Machine.
column3: In the morning there was the getting of the Time Machine.

column2: Towards that, as yet, I had only my iron mace.
column3: Towards that, as yet, I had only my iron mace.

column2: But now, with my growing knowledge, I felt very differently towards those bronze doors.
column3: But now, with my growing knowledge, I felt very differently towards those bronze doors.

column2: Up to this, I had refrained from forcing them, largely because of the mystery on the other side.
column3: Up to this, I had refrained from forcing them, largely because of the mystery on the other side.
